keyword: how many calories are in scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in scrambled eggs (2 large), plus full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: 2 large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total; no milk, cheese, or additional ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and recipe. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: Two scrambled eggs provide about 180 kcal and 12 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Two scrambled eggs have roughly 12.6 g protein.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 13.4 g total fat for two, mostly from eggs and cooking butter.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: 1 tbsp milk adds ~10 kcal; it also slightly increases carbs.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Two eggs provide ~400 mg cholesterol, mainly from the yolks.
